channel.title: Collections on HIST4806A Museums + Digital History
channel.description: Recent content in Collections on HIST4806A Museums + Digital History

item.title: Making an API with Datasette and Glitch
item.description: Please note that this course website is equipped with the Hypothes.is annotation layer. If a step is not clear, or there is missing information, or you get stuck, please highlight the relevant text and leave an annotation in our class Hypothesis group to alert me. Our end goal - or one of our end goals - is to get the material out of the museum, out of the printed page, and online where someone can query it, filter it, extract items of interest, mash it together with other data, or something else entirely that we haven’t thought of yet.

item.title: Detecting and Extracting Hand-written text
item.description: Please note that this course website is equipped with the Hypothes.is annotation layer. If a step is not clear, or there is missing information, or you get stuck, please highlight the relevant text and leave an annotation in our class Hypothesis group to alert me. Acknowledgement All of this was taught to me by my MA student, Jeff Blackadar. Computer Vision In recent years, computer vision technologies have been improving in leaps and bounds.

item.title: Canadian Museum of History Visit
item.description: Please note that this course website is equipped with the Hypothes.is annotation layer. If anything below requires clarification or sparks a thought, please highlight the relevant text and leave an annotation in our class Hypothesis group. Please also, if you spot someone has left an annotation, read their annotation and respond appropriately and helpfully if you can. January 20th, Visit to the Candian Museum of History If you missed our trip on the 20th, you missed a real treat.
